name: Scientific Variables Ontology
description: SVO is a framework that enables modular, principled expression, manipulation, and creation of scientific variable concepts. It provides: --An upper ontology that outlines the elementary concept categories, such as Property, Phenomenon or Process that are used to build modular components that can then be combined in custom ways to generate unique variable concepts;  --A set of machine-readable rules that define how elementary concepts can be combined to create more complex concepts; --An extensible lower ontology that declares all of the instances of the concept category classes defined in the upper ontology..       A simple search interface that allows casual users to browse the current database using exact term match of both preferred and alternate (synonym) labels stored in the ontology; --A SPARQL endpoint that provides a programmatic interface for querying the ontology database, as well as a SPARQL web interface for testing out SPARQL queries; --An API for matching freeform strings to concepts in the ontology using information from public linked data catalogs, a concept-based graph search, and the ontology blueprint. Experimental, in development; --A GUI tool for constructing new variables using graph-based concept detection and the templates provided in the upper ontology. In development.

additionalProperty.name: Bibligraphic citation
additionalProperty.value: Scott Peckham, 2019. Scientific Variables Ontology. http://www.geoscienceontology.org/index.html. Accessed 11/6/2019

additionalProperty.name: primary publication
additionalProperty.value: M. Stoica and S. D. Peckham, “An Ontology Blueprint for Constructing Qualitative and Quantitative Scientific Variables,” in Proceedings of the ISWC 2018 Posters & Demonstrations, Industry and Blue Sky Ideas Tracks colocated with 17th International Semantic Web Conference (ISWC 2018), Monterey, USA, October 8th - to - 12th, 2018., 2018
